load_order.desc: Specify the VM by its load order: PRE_LAUNCHED_VM, SOS_VM or POST_LAUNCHED_VM.

name.desc: Specify the VM name which will be shown in hypervisor console command: vm_list.

guest_flags.desc: Select all applicable flags for the VM

vcpu_affinity.desc: vCPU affinity map. Each vCPU will pin to the selected pCPU ID. Please make sure each vCPU pin to different pCPU.

clos.desc: Class of Service for Cache Allocation Technology. Please refer SDM 17.19.2 for details and use with caution.

base.desc: SGX EPC section base, must be page aligned

size.desc: SGX EPC section size in Bytes, must be page aligned

start_hpa.desc: The start physical address in host for the VM

size.desc: The memory size in Bytes for the VM

start_hpa2.desc: Start of second HPA for non-contiguous allocations in host for the VM

size_hpa2.desc: Memory size of second HPA for non-contiguous allocations in Bytes for the VM

name.desc: Specify the OS name of VM, currently it is not referenced by hypervisor code.

os_config.name: ClearLinux

kern_type.desc: Specify the kernel image type so that hypervisor could load it correctly. Currently support KERNEL_BZIMAGE and KERNEL_ZEPHYR.

kern_mod.desc: The tag for kernel image which act as multiboot module, it must exactly match the module tag in GRUB multiboot cmdline.

ramdisk_mod.desc: The tag for ramdisk image which act as multiboot module, it must exactly match the module tag in GRUB multiboot cmdline.

os_config.bootargs: rw rootwait noxsave nohpet no_timer_check ignore_loglevel log_buf_len=16M consoleblank=0 tsc=reliable

base.desc: vUART0 (A.K.A COM1) enabling switch. Enable by exposing its base address, disable by returning invalid base address.
vUART1 (A.K.A COM2) enabling switch. Enable by exposing its base address, disable by returning invalid base address.

target_vm_id.desc: COM2 is used for VM communications. When it is enabled, please specify which target VM that current VM connect to.

target_uart_id.desc: target vUART ID that vCOM2 connect to
